dialogues.Mal: If I jumped, would I survive?  I thought you might be missing me...  So what?  Looks like Arthur's taste.  Tell me...  Do the children miss me?  What're you doing?  The gun, Dom.  Please.  That depends on what you're threatening. Killing him would just wake him up... but pain? Pain is in the mind...  And, judging by the decor, we're in your mind, aren't we, Arthur?  He was close. Very close.    Cobb fumbles in his pockets, pulls out his spinning top. He tries to set it spinning on the back edge of the sink, but it FALLS to the floor and rolls towards the door- Saito is there. WATCHING Cobb. He looks down at the spinning top.   You remember when you asked me to marry you?  You said you had a dream...  And we can. You know how to find me... you know what you have to do.   Ariadne follows Cobb into the kitchen. A THIN MAN is there, standing by the table. He holds a FOLDED PIECE OF PAPER.   What are you doing here?  I know who you are. What are you doing here?  How could you understand? Do you know what it is to be a lover? To be half of a whole?  I'll tell you a riddle. You're waiting for a train. A train that will take you far away. You know where you hope this train will take you, but you don't know for sure...  But... it doesn't matter. How can it not matter to you where that train will take you?  How could you bring her here, Dom?  you PROMISED! YOU SAID WE'D BE         Mal opens a DOLL'S HOUSE. Inside is a SAFE. She opens it- it is empty. She pulls out her SPINNING TOP.    Cobb is trying to calm Mal, who is hysterical.    Mal shakes her head at Cobb as he USHERS the children out of the room, FACES UNSEEN-   They're projections, Dom. Your dreams. I'm their mother-don't you think I can tell the difference?    And you don't believe me!  Join me.  No. I'm going to jump. And you're coming with me.  We've talked enough.  Come out onto the ledge or I'll jump right now.  I'm asking you to take a leap of faith.  If I go without you, they'll take them away, anyway.  I filed a letter with our attorney. Explaining how I'm fearful for my safety, how you've threatened to kill me...  I love you, Dom. I've freed you from the guilt of choosing to leave them. We're going home to our real children.  You're waiting for a train...    A train that will take you far away...  You know where you hope this train will take you, you can't know for sure...  But it doesn't matter...  Because you'll be together...   Cobb stands with the Thin Man, who has a piece of paper.   Hello.  The smallest idea, such as... "Your world is not real."  A simple little thought that changes everything...  So certain of your world. Of what's real. Do you think he is- Or do you think he's as lost as I was?  What are the distinguishing characteristics of a dream? Mutable laws of physics? Tell that to the quantum physicists. Reappearance of the dead? What about heaven and hell? Persecution of the dreamer, the creator, the messiah? They crucified Christ, didn't they?  No creeping doubts? Not feeling persecuted, Dom? Chased around the globe by anonymous corporations and police forces? The way the projections persecute the dreamer?  Admit it, Dom. You don't believe in one reality anymore. So choose. Choose your reality like I did. Choose to be here. Choose me.  You're wrong, Dom. You're confused... our children are here-      These are our children. Watch. Hey, James! Philippa?!  You keep telling yourself that but you don't believe it-  And what if you're wrong? What if I'm what's real?  You keep telling yourself what you know... but what do you believe? What do you feel?  What truth?  How could you know it was a lie?     Because you'll be together.  That death was the only escape?  You killed me.  You infected my mind. You betrayed me. But you can make amends. You can still keep your promise. We can still be together... right here. In our world. The world we built together.  You can't have him.  Fischer's on the porch.  Not real? I'm the only thing you do believe in anymore. Here-doesn't this feel real, Dom?  We'd be together forever. You promised me.  You remember when you asked me to marry you? You said you dreamt that we'd grow old together.   Cobb enters with Miles. Drops his bags. Moves to the table, looking out at the overgrown garden. He reaches into his pocket, takes out his pewter spinning top, lowers it to the table and SPINS IT- a CHILD'S SHOUT makes him look up-  Through the window, James and Philippa have run into view, playing, THEIR FACES TURNED AWAY... Cobb STARES at the back of his children's heads... Miles moves to the window and KNOCKS on the glass-  James and Philippa TURN- see their Dad. He steps to the window, watching their BRIGHT FACES SHINING as they run towards him...  Behind him, on the table, the spinning top is STILL SPINNING. And we-
dialogues.Arthur: What Mr. Cobb is trying to say-  Yes. In the dream state, conscious defenses are lowered and your thoughts become vulnerable to theft. It's called extraction.  He knows.  What's going on up there?   Todashi checks his watch: THE SECOND HAND TICKS IN REAL TIME. Another TRAIN PASSES in the opposite direction with a MIGHTY WHUMP- Todashi's eyes FLY to Nash's sleeping face-  NASH JERKS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN, and we-   Saito knows. He's playing with us.  What's she doing here, Cobb?  See that you do. We're here to work.  I know! We have to reconnect the loop before they wake up!  I'm not going to make it! Wake Cobb!  Dunk him!  They're getting closer, Cobb.  Come on, Cobb.  Not good.  Asshole!  How could you get the carpet wrong?!  You're the architect-  And you-what the hell was all that?  I'd hate to see out of control-  Why? He's not gonna search every compartment.  I can keep him under for one minute-  Our ride's on the roof.  Cobb... are you okay?  Down in the dream... Mal showing up like that ...  It's getting worse, isn't it?  Hasn't shown. Wanna wait?  Where will you go?  Stateside.  Of course not.  Okay, here's planting an idea: I say to you, "Don't think about elephants."    Right. But it's not your idea because you know I gave it to you.  The subject's mind can always trace the genesis of the idea. True inspiration is impossible to fake.  Cobb, come on-  Cobb, we should walk away from this.  I know how much you want to go home-  But this can't be done.  You don't know that!-  Did it work?  Who did you do it to?  So why are we headed to Paris?  That's why the military developed dream sharing-a training program where soldiers could strangle, stab and shoot each other, then wake up.  Five minutes in the real world gives you an hour in the dream.  It's okay.  The only way to wake from inside the dream is to die.  Some kind of personal icon. A small object that you can always have with you, and that no one else knows,  Sounds like you've met Mrs. Cobb.  So. A totem. You need something small, potentially heavy...  Too common. You need something that has a weight or movement that only you know.  A loaded die.  I can't let you handle it. That's the point. No one else can know the weight or balance of it.  So when you examine your totem...  You know, beyond a doubt, that you're not in someone else's dream.  Why not?  Where will you be?  Eames? But he's in Mombasa. Cobol's backyard.  There are plenty of other thieves.  He said you'd be back.  But there's nothing else quite like it.  Shall we take a look at paradoxical architecture?  You're going to have to master a few tricks if you're going to build three complete dream levels.  In a dream, you can cheat architecture into impossible shapes.  That lets you create closed loops, like the Penrose Steps. The infinite staircase.  See...  Paradox. A closed loop like this helps you disguise the boundaries of the dream you've created.  Anything from the floor of a building, to an entire city. But it has to be complicated enough for us to hide from the projections.  And the better the maze-  You wait, they'll turn ugly. No one likes to see someone else messing around in their mind.  I don't know if he can't, but he won't. He thinks it's safer if he doesn't know the layouts.  He won't tell me. I think it's Mal. I think she's getting stronger.  She's not his ex.  No. No, she's dead, Ariadne. What you see in there is just his projection of her.    How deep?  A dream within a dream within a dream? Is that even possible?  How do you translate a business strategy into an emotion?  Might? We'll have to do better than that.  Forgive me for wanting a little specificity, Eames.  How do you produce these emotional triggers?  Are those yours?  Yusuf?    Eames, I'm impressed.  It'd have to be a 747.  On a 747 the pilots are up above, first class is in the nose so nobody walks through the cabin. We'd have to buyout the whole cabin, and the first class flight attendant-  My question is how we go down three layers with enough stability. Three layers down a little turbulence is gonna translate into an earthquake. The dreams are gonna collapse with the slightest disturbance.  How do we get out once we've made the plant? I hope you've got something a little more elegant in mind than shooting me in the head like last time.  But how are we going to feel that through the sedation?  Even that won't cut through three layers of deep sleep.  We can use the musical countdown to synchronize the different kicks.    Everybody okay? Saito?  I don't know. What happened back there? Where were you?     Fischer's had an extractor teach his mind to defend itself. His subconscious is militarized. It should've shown on the research-   Calm down.   Cobb, we've dealt with sub-security before. We just have to be more-   Unconstructed dream space.  Raw, infinite subconscious. Nothing there but what was left behind by anyone on the team who's been trapped there before. On this team... just Cobb.  Let's just get him upstairs.  Hold this. Firm pressure.  You knew the risks and you didn't tell us.  You had no right.  And you. You went along with this?  You trusted him? When? When he promised you half his share?  Oh, yeah? With Mal? That worked out great, didn't it, Cobb?  In. your lather's office, below the bookshelves, is his personal safe. We need the combination.  We have it on good authority that you do.  Good authority.  The combination.  Why would Browning tell us you did?  That helps us?  But how do you reconcile them if they're that estranged?  Well, work fast-Fischer's projections are closing in quick, we need to break out of here before we're totally boxed in...  What about his security? It's going to get worse as we go deeper.  No.  A bad idea.  Sure. But it didn't work. The subject realized he was dreaming and his subconscious tore us to pieces.  And don't make the jump too soon- that kick is our only way back, we have to be ready to catch it-  And there goes Mr. Charles.  It's a gambit designed to turn Fischer against his own subconscious.  Because it involves telling the mark that he's dreaming. Which involves attracting a lot of attention to us.  You must've noticed by now how much time Cobb spends doing things he says never to do.  Cobb's drawing Fischer's attention to the strangeness of the dream. That's making his subconscious look for the dreamer. For me.  So, if everything's correct, this room should be directly below 528.  No, I have to judge it myself. Once you're all asleep up in room 528, I wait `til Yusuf starts his kick...  His music warns me it's coming, then the van hitting the barrier of the bridge should be unmistakable- that's when I blow the floor out from underneath us and we get a nice synchronized kick. Too soon, and we won't get pulled out; too late and I won't be able to drop us.  The van will be in free fall. I can't drop us with no gravity.  Mr. Charles!  Shhhh!  He's out.    I'll lead them on a merry chase.  I'm on it.  Hey!  No, Yusuf. Too soon!  Paradox.  How the hell do I drop you?  What happened?  With Mal?  He'll be lost...
dialogues.Eames: You never know.  You're buying.  Piss off.  Versatile.  Word is, you're not welcome in these parts.  There's a price on your head from Cobol Engineering. Pretty big one, actually.  `Course I would.  It's perfectly possible. Just bloody difficult.  Arthur? You're still working with that stick-in-the-mud?   The best. But he has no imagination. If you're going to perform inception, you need imagination.   Yeas and no. We tried it. Got the idea in place, but it didn't take.   It's not just about depth. You need the simplest version of the idea- the one that will grow naturally in the subject's mind. Subtle art.   What's the idea you need to plant?   See, right there you've got various political motivations, anti- monopolistic sentiment and so forth. But all that stuff's at the mercy of the subject's prejudice- you have to go to the basic.   The relationship with the father. Do you have a chemist?  Cobb shakes his head.   There's a man here. Yusuf. He formulates his own versions of the compounds.  Once you've lost your tail. Back by the bar, blue tie. Came in about two minutes after we did.  They pretty much own Mombasa.  Back here?  Freddy!  Freddy Simmonds, it is you!    This is your idea of losing a tail?  That's where we come in. How's Robert Fischer's relationship to his father?  Can you get me access to him? Browning. Fischer senior's right- hand man. Fischer junior's godfather.  References are something of a specialty for me, Mr. Saito.    They come here every day to sleep?  Do you play on that? Suggest breaking up his father's company as a 'screw you' to the old man?  Try this... "MY FATHER ACCEPTS THAT  Thanks for the contribution, Arthur.  We could split the idea into emotional triggers, and use one on each level.  On the top level, we open up his relationship with his father.... Say: "I WILL NOT FOLLOW IN MY FATHER'S FOOTSTEPS." Next level down we've accessed his ambition and self-esteem. We feed him: "I  That could do it.  I forge each emotional concept in the style and manner of Peter Browning, a key figure in Fischer's emotional life.  Saito, when do I get to see Browning?  The vultures are circling. The sicker Maurice Fischer becomes, the stronger Peter Browning becomes...  I've had time to learn Browning's physical presence and mannerisms...  Now, in the dream, I can impersonate Browning and suggest the concepts to Fischer's conscious mind... Then we take Fischer down another level and his own subconscious feeds it right back to him.  Precisely. That's the only way to make it stick. It has to seem self-generated.  Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated, Arthur.  He's not scheduled for surgery, no dental, nothing.  Nothing they'd put him under for. Besides, we need a good ten hours.  Math was never my strong suit.  It's not going to take us long to crack Fischer open once we get going. We'll be out in a couple days, max.  That, Ariadne, would be a kick.  Oh, sorry.  Bit too much free champagne before takeoff, Yusuf?  Sorry, I thought it was free. Maybe we could share.  I'm afraid-  Get us out of here!  So we put him out of his misery.  Eames steps into the room, pulls his gun and moves over Saito.   He's in agony. Let's wake him up-  What do you mean, it won't wake him? When you die in a dream you wake up.  So what happens if one of us dies?  How long?  Great. So now we're stuck in Fischer's mind battling it out with his private army, and if we get hit we're stuck in Limbo 'til our brains dissolve into scrambled egg?  So you led us into a war zone with no way out.  Forget it. We go any deeper, we just raise the stakes. I'm sitting it out on this level.  What's inside?  Useful?  An hour? I was supposed to have all night to crack him.    I'm working on that.  Shouldn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, Arthur-  Shall we?  We need the imagery, the words...  Hell, we should be charging Fischer as much as Saito.  Who's Mr. Charles?  So you've done it before?  You learned a lot, though. Right?  No problem. How about a pretty young lady I've used before?  You look a bit perkier.  Feels closer. That's Yusuf's driving.  Get off at a different floor and keep moving. Dump the wallet, then meet me in the lobby. The security will try to track it down. We need to buy Cobb a little more time.  That's Fischer's projection of Browning. We'll keep an eye on how he behaves-  How he acts will tell us if Fischer's starting to suspect his motives the way we want him to.  Then who guides Fischer in? You?  Cobb? Are you hearing that?  I noticed it twenty minutes ago-at first I thought it was just wind...  What do we do?  Cobb? Did we miss it?  What the hell do we do now?  What next kick?  Cobb? Something's wrong?  They're heading your way. Like they know something.  On my way.  What happened?  So that it, then? We failed.  It's you who doesn't get back to your family.  I wanted to know what was going to happen in there. I think we had this one.  We're almost out of time-  Okay, Saito can hold them off while I plant the rest of the charges.  Go for it, but I'm taking the kick whether you're back or not...  Come on, Saito. I need you to cover Fischer while I plant the charges.  Get in there-quick!  )
dialogues.Nash: What're you doing?! It's too soon-  He won't wake!  Ah, yes, but you see, Mr. Saito-  We're in mine.  GONE. The music DIES. Saito and the rioters stand there in the SILENCE, the light DWINDLING... and we-   It wasn't my fault!  I didn't know he was going to rub his damn cheek on it!
dialogues.Ariadne: Pleased to meet you.  A work placement?    Why?  Such as?  I'm discovering it.  How?  But are you trying to fool him that the dream is actually real life?  How could I ever get enough detail to Convince him that it's real?  But all the textures of real life- the stone, the fabric. cars... people... your mind can't create all this.  I guess.  We came here from...  Oh my God. We're dreaming.    How did architects get involved?  We were only asleep for five minutes? We talked for an hour at least...  Who are the people?  Yours?  How else do you do it?  Then you break in and steal it.  I love the concrete sense of things- Real weight, you know? I thought a dream space would be all about the visual, but it's the feel of things. Question is, what happens as you start to mess with physics...  It's something, isn't it?  Why are they looking at me?  Converge?  They're going to attack us?  Mind telling your subconscious to take it easy?    You have to draw from what you know-  Why not?  Did that happen to you?  Is that why you need me to build your dreams?  Wake me up, Cobb.  Wake me up!  Why couldn't I wake?  What?  That's some subconscious you've got, Cobb. She's a real charmer!    Like a coin?  What's yours?  Why?  That's not an issue for me.  Arthur, maybe you can't see what's going on, maybe you don't want to. But Cobb's got problems he's tried to bury down there. I'm not going to open my mind to someone like that.  I tried not to come.  No paper, no pens... nothing between you and raw, direct creation.  What sort of tricks?  How big do the levels have to be?  A maze.  The longer we have before the projections catch us.  My subconscious seems polite enough.  Cobb can't build anymore, can he?  Why?  His ex-wife?  They're still together?  What was she like in real life?  You're back.  Are you going under on your own?  Just working on my totem.  It's an elegant solution to keeping track of reality. Your invention?  Arthur told me she died.  Good. Each level relates to the part of the subject's subconscious we're trying to access. I'm making the bottom level a hospital, so that Fischer will bring his father there-  Why's that so important?  In case you bring Mal in.  You won't build yourself because if you know the maze, then she knows it. And she'd sabotage the operation. You can't keep her out, can you?  Do the others know?  You have to warn them if it's getting worse-  Why can't you go home, Cobb?  How did she die?  For what?  How much time?  And ten years in the third level. Who wants to spend ten years in a dream?  What's a kick?  I wanted to know what "tests" you need to do on your own every night.  Why do you do this to yourself?  Is it so important to dream?  But these aren't just dreams, are they? They're memories. You said never to use memories.  You're keeping her alive.  You can't let her go.  What've you got buried down there that you regret?  This is your house?  Where is she?  My name is-  I don't know. Trying to understand.  No.  What is this place?  What happened here?  You think you can just build a prison of memories to lock her in? You think that's going to contain her?    The team needs someone in there who understands what you're struggling with. If you don't want it to be me then you need to show Arthur what I just saw.  This wasn't in the design-  I didn't.   How could they be trained?   Limbo?  What's down there?  How long would we be stuck there?  He's in a lot of pain.    What will that do to him?  When were you trapped in Limbo?  Cobb, you might have convinced the rest of this team to carry on with the job. But they don't know the truth.  The truth that at any minute you might bring a freight train through the wall. The truth that Mal is bursting up through your subconscious.  The truth that as we go deeper into Fischer, we're also going deeper into you-and I'm not sure we're going to like what we find there.  This is not just about Fischer, it's about you. Tell me what happened to you and Mal. Trapped in Limbo.  How long were you stuck?  How did you stand it?  But not for her?  And when you finally woke up?  What was it?  What about your children?  Psychiatrists judged her sane?  Then why should you blame yourself?  It might have been your idea to push the limits, Cobb. But you're not responsible for the idea that destroyed her. The idea that her world wasn't real... that was her own idea from her own mind.  Your guilt defines her. Powers her. If we're going to succeed in this, you're going to have to forgive yourself, and you're going to have to confront her. But you don't have to do it alone.  I'm doing it for the others. They don't know the risk they've taken coming in here with you.  So you destroy his one positive relationship?  Who or what, exactly, is Mr. Charles?  And why don't you approve?  Didn't Cobb say never to do that?  What's happening?  Do you use a timer?  How will you know?  Why not?  Wait, Cobb-I'm lost. Whose subconscious are we going into?  Cobb? Cobb?  What's down there?  I meant what's down there for you?  I designed the place.  How long do we have?  Sixty minutes.  I don't think so. They've still got to climb down to the middle terrace.  The building's designed as a labyrinth.  Yes.  I shouldn't tell you. If Mal-  Utility closets, trap doors...  Ducts. He added an air duct system- it doesn't follow the maze. They can use it to go straight from the outer walls to the upper tower.    What was that?    Wouldn't be very strong if it did. Look, if you wanted to design it yourself-  These projections, they're part of his subconscious?  Are you destroying those parts of his mind?  Fischer, stop! It's a trap!-  Cobb, that's not really her-  Fischer, look out!-  Cobb, she's just a projection. Fischer... he's real.  Eames? Get to the anteroom now!  Mal killed Fischer-  There's still a way: We follow Fischer down-  Down there they'll be enough time. We'll find him-soon as you hear Arthur's music start, you use the defibrillator to revive him-we give him his own early kick from below.  Get him in there- Then, as the music ends you blow the hospital and we all ride the kick back up through the layers.  We have to try!  Can I trust you to do what's needed? Mal's down there-  How do you know?  This is your world?  You built all this?  It's incredible.    You reconstructed them all from memory?  What's that?  Will she be in there?  How do we send Fischer back?  What?  Why?  We need Fischer.  Cobb, what are you saying?  Cobb, you can't do this.  He's here. And it's time. But you have to come with us.  Cobb, I'm not going to let you lose yourself in here! You have to get back to your children!  You can't stay here to be with her-  No!  Improvising.  You're coming!  Don't lose yourself. Find Saito. And bring him back.  Cobb stayed.  No. To find Saito.  No. He'll be alright.
dialogues.Cobb: What's the most resilient parasite?  A bacteria? A virus?  An intestinal worm?  An idea.  Resilient, highly contagious. Once an idea's taken hold in the brain it's almost impossible to eradicate. A person can cover it up, ignore it- but it stays there.  Information, yes. But an idea? Fully formed, understood? That sticks... In there, somewhere.  But, Mr. Saito, we can train your subconscious to defend itself from even the most skilled extractor.  Because I am the most skilled extractor. I know how to search your mind and find your secrets. I know the tricks, and I can teach them to your subconscious so that even when you're asleep, your guard is never down.  But if I'm going to help you, you have to be completely open to me. I'll need to know my way around your thoughts better than your wife, your analyst, anyone. If this is a dream and you've got a safe full of secrets, I need to know what's in that safe. For this to work, you have to let me in.   Todashi checks his watch: THE SECOND HAND TICKS IN REAL TIME. Another TRAIN PASSES in the opposite direction with a MIGHTY WHUMP- Todashi's eyes FLY to Nash's sleeping face-  NASH JERKS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN, and we-   I can get it here. The information's in the safe- he looked right at it when I mentioned secrets.  You just get to your room. I'll take care of the rest.  With a clean dive, perhaps. Mal, why are you here?  I am. But I can't trust you anymore.  Actually, Mr. Saito is partial to postwar British painters.  Would you sit down?  You can't imagine.  Getting some air.  Stay seated. Please.  Did she tell you, or have you known all along?  No point threatening him in a dream.   You came prepared.  Hard for a man in your position to keep a love nest totally secret... particularly when there's a married woman involved.  And yet, here we are.  With a dilemma.  Not quite. The key piece of information wasn't there, was it, Mr. Saito?  You held something back because you knew what we were up to...  So why let us in at all?  Audition for what?  I extracted all the information you had in there.  You know the corporation who hired us won't accept failure. We won't last two days...  So now I have to do this the old- fashioned way-  We're not in your dream-  Lets go.  I had it under control.  There's no time for this-I'm getting off at Kyoto.  I can't stand trains.  Every man for himself.  Hey, guys. How are you?  Who's just okay? Was that James?  I can't. Not for a while.  Well, James, like I've told you-I'm away because I'm working...  Philippa, can you ask Grandma to pick up the phone-  Well, we'll just have to hope Grandma's wrong about that won't we?  Yes?  No. No, we talked about this, James. Mommy's gone.  I'll give some presents to Grandpa, okay? Just be good for-  Yeah, why?  Yeah. I'm sorry about your leg.  One apology's all you're getting, Arthur. Now, where's Nash?    Buenos Aires. I can lie low there. Maybe sniff out a job when things quiet down. You?  )  That's not how I deal with things.  What will you do to him?  What do you want from us?  No, it isn't.  I won't do it.  Are you giving me a choice? Because I can find my own way to square things with Cobol.  And I choose to leave.  You can't fix that. Nobody could.  How complex is the idea?  No idea's simple when you have to plant it in someone else's mind.  If I were to do it. If I could do it... how do I know you can deliver?    It can. You just have to go deep enough.  I've done it before.    We're going to need a new architect.  You never did like your office.  Extradition between France and the U.S. is a bureaucratic nightmare.  Can you take these back for the kids?  I know. I thought you could talk to Marie about bringing them on vacation. Somewhere I could meet-  You were married for twenty years.  Doesn't she understand that my kids need me?  Be realistic, Stephen. They'd never understand- they'd lock me up and throwaway the key. Or worse.  Lawyers don't pay for themselves. This is what I have. This is what you taught me.  No, you taught me to navigate other people's minds. But after what happened with Mal there weren't a whole lot of legitimate ways for me to use that skill.  I found a way home. A job. For powerful people. If I pull it off, I can get back to my family. But I need help.  If you have someone good enough, you have to let them decide for themselves. You know what I'm offering-  No, not just money: the chance to build cathedrals, entire cities- things that have never existed, things that couldn't exist in the real world...  That's not what you used to say. You told me that in the real world I'd be building attic conversions and gas stations. You said that if I mastered the dream-share I'd have a whole new way of creating and showing people my creations. You told me it would free me.  No, you weren't. Your vision was a vision of pure creativity. It's where we took it that was wrong.  They won't actually come on the job, they'll just design the levels and teach them to the dreamers.  Mal won't let me.  You want to know what's real, Stephen? Your grandchildren waiting for their dad to come back.  This job-this last job-is how I get there. They've got someone with access to your father's office and they're trying to open his safe-they thought I'd know the combination, but I don't-    He did, he just didn't tell you that it was a combination.  Something only you would know. Some meaningful combination of numbers from your experiences with Maurice-  Perhaps after your mother died...  He always had a hard time with emotional-  He loved you, Robert. In his way.  These people are going to kill us if we don't give them the combination.  I heard them-they're going to lock us in and run the can into the river.  Something for you. Maurice always said it was his most previous gift... a will.  It's an alternate. It supersedes the other only if you want it to.  It splits all the component businesses of Fischer Morrow into individual companies, transferring ownership to the boards of those companies...  A basic living. Nothing more. The entire empire would cease to exist.  I don't know, Robert.  I'm sorry?  Good-looking fellow, I'm sure.  No, Robert-  Fischer Morrow's been my entire life. I can't let you destroy it.  I couldn't take the chance of you rising to your father's final taunt.  That will. I'm sorry, Robert, but it's his final insult. A challenge to build something for yourself. He's telling you that you aren't worthy of his achievements.  I'm so sorry. But he was wrong. You'll make his company even greater than he ever could.  I'm sorry, Robert.
dialogues.Yusuf: Come, come.  Ah, yes. Mr. Cobb. I've heard so very much about you. please.  Bloody cats.  You work using Somnacin, I think, Mr. Cobb?    Better.  Binds the dreamers tight. Let's them dream as one. Makes it real. Of course, if you'd prefer, you could use Somnacin brand. If you could explain to the international control council what you wanted it for.  You are seeking a chemist? To formulate compounds for a job?  I rarely go into the held, Mr. Cobb.  Which are?  A dream within a dream? Two levels?  Not possible. That many dreams within dreams would be too unstable.  A powerful sedative. How many team members?  Of course. I use it every day.  Perhaps... you will not want to see.  They come every day. To share the dream.  See? Very stable.  Three, four hours. Every day.  With this compound... about forty hours. Each and every day.  Tell him, Mr. Cobb.  Do you still dream, Mr. Cobb?  Sharp, no?  Yup. Sorry.  Sedation. For sleep stable enough to create three layers of dreaming...  We will have to combine it with an extremely powerful sedative....  The compound we'll be using to share the dream is an advanced Somnacin derivative. It creates a very clear connection between dreamers, whilst actually accelerating brain function.  Brain function in the dream will be about twenty times normal.  And when you go into a dream within that dream the effect is compounded.  Three dreams... that's ten hours, times twenty, times twenty, times twenty...  Depends on the dream.  That's the clever part. I customize the sedative...  To leave inner ear function unimpaired...  That way, however deep the sleep, the sleeper will still feel falling...  Or tipping...  Sorry.  Ha bloody ha.  Not from this. We're too heavily sedated to wake up that way.  You couldn't even think about trying to escape until the sedation eases-  Decades-it could be infinite-I don't know! Ask him-he's the one who's been there before!  I trusted him.    Five hundred dollars, this cost?  Cash, cards, ID... and this-  I'll use the music to let you know when it's coming, but the rest is up to you.  Everyone ready?  Sweet dreams-  Bugger.  Sod it. I hope your ready.
dialogues.Maurice: Eames sits in the crowded room. Boxes and files are piled high. Browning stands by a pair of double doors.    The office is a MAKESHIFT HOSPITAL ROOM: a BED where the desk should be. Browning addresses a figure at the window. ROBERT FISCHER, 30'S, abstracted.

description: Dom Cobb is a skilled thief, the absolute best in the dangerous art of extraction, stealing valuable secrets from deep within the subconscious during the dream state, when the mind is at its most vulnerable. Cobb's rare ability has made him a coveted player in this treacherous new world of corporate espionage, but it has also made him an international fugitive and cost him everything he has ever loved. Now Cobb is being offered a chance at redemption. One last job could give him his life back but only if he can accomplish the impossible, inception. Instead of the perfect heist, Cobb and his team of specialists have to pull off the reverse: their task is not to steal an idea, but to plant one. If they succeed, it could be the perfect crime. But no amount of careful planning or expertise can prepare the team for the dangerous enemy that seems to predict their every move. An enemy that only Cobb could have seen coming.—Warner Bros. Pictures
